discover.instruction: Read about this room. Notice the highlighted prepositions.

content.text: Welcome to my room! There is a bed <highlight>in</highlight> the corner. <highlight>On</highlight> the bed, there is a cat. <highlight>Under</highlight> the bed, there are some boxes. There is a desk <highlight>near</highlight> the window. <highlight>On</highlight> the desk, there is a computer. <highlight>In</highlight> the drawer, there are pencils. There are pictures <highlight>on</highlight> the wall. The bookshelf is <highlight>next to</highlight> the door. <highlight>Between</highlight> the desk and the bed, there is a small table. My bag is <highlight>behind</highlight> the door.
content.question: What do these prepositions tell us?

theory.title: Prepositions of Place - Where things are

points.example: in the box, in the room, in the car, in Moscow
on the table, on the wall, on the floor, on the bus
under the table, under the bed
next to the bank, near the park

points.rule: BETWEEN - in the middle of two things
points.example: between the chairs, between me and you
behind the house, in front of the school

notice.instruction: Find all prepositions and identify what they describe.

tasks.text: I live in a small apartment. The kitchen is next to the living room. There is a big window in the living room. On the window, there are flowers. Under the window, there is a sofa. The TV is in front of the sofa. Between the sofa and the TV, there is a coffee table. My cat likes to sleep under the table. There is a painting on the wall behind the sofa. My bedroom is between the bathroom and the kitchen.

find.phrase: Between the sofa and the TV
between the bathroom and the kitchen

notice.reflection_question: What's the difference between 'in the table' and 'on the table'?

questions.explanation: At the entrance = in front of

sentences.incorrect: The book is in the table.
sentences.correct: The book is on the table.

sentences.incorrect: The cinema is among the bank and the shop.
sentences.correct: The cinema is between the bank and the shop.

produce.instruction: Describe where things are in your room.
prompts: What is next to the window?
produce.example: My bed is in the corner of the room. On my bed, there is a pillow. Under my bed, there are some boxes. Next to the window, there is my desk. On the desk, there is my laptop. There are posters on the wall. Behind the door, there is my bag.

input_flood.description: Read 5 texts with many prepositions of place.

texts.title: Finding the Keys
texts.content: Where are my keys? They are not on the table. They are not in my bag. Let me look under the sofa. No, not there. Maybe they are behind the cushion? Yes! They were between the cushions on the sofa. They are always in strange places!

texts.title: My Street
texts.content: I live on a nice street. My house is between two big buildings. In front of my house, there is a small garden. Behind the house, there is a parking area. Next to my house, there is a bakery. Near the bakery, there is a pharmacy. There is a bus stop on the corner.

texts.title: The Office
texts.content: In my office, there is a big desk. On the desk, there is a computer. Under the desk, there are cables. The printer is next to the window. There are files in the drawer. A calendar is on the wall behind my chair. My bag is under my desk.

texts.title: The Park
texts.content: The park is near my house. In the park, there are many trees. There is a pond in the center. Ducks swim on the pond. Between the trees, there are benches. Children play on the grass. Behind the pond, there is a cafe.

texts.title: The Kitchen
texts.content: In my kitchen, there is a big fridge. On the fridge, there are magnets. Next to the fridge, there is the stove. There are pots on the stove. Under the counter, there are cabinets. In the cabinets, there are plates. On the counter, there is a microwave.

grammar_cards.front:
The book is ___ the table.
(in / on / under)
grammar_cards.back:
on the table

On a surface = on

in Tokyo

Inside a city = in

grammar_cards.front: The cat is hiding ___ the bed.
The bank is ___ the post office and the cafe.

Find the error:
"The picture is in the wall."
grammar_cards.back:
The picture is on the wall.

Surface = on (not in)

Using at instead of in for cities
